distribution.name: archive.zip
distribution.description: Archive containing all the contents of the Rain in Australia dataset

distribution.name: weatherAUS.csv
distribution.description:
This dataset contains about 10 years of daily weather observations from numerous Australian weather stations. 

RainTomorrow is the target variable to predict. It means -- did it rain the next day, Yes or No? 
This column is Yes if the rain for that day was 1mm or more.

field.name: Date
field.description: The date of observation

field.name: Location
field.description: The common name of the location of the weather station

field.name: MinTemp
field.description: The minimum temperature in degrees celsius

field.name: MaxTemp
field.description: The maximum temperature in degrees celsius

field.name: Rainfall
field.description: The amount of rainfall recorded for the day in mm

field.name: Evaporation
field.description: The so-called Class A pan evaporation (mm) in the 24 hours to 9am

field.name: Sunshine
field.description: The number of hours of bright sunshine in the day.

field.name: WindGustDir
field.description: The direction of the strongest wind gust in the 24 hours to midnight

field.name: WindGustSpeed
field.description: The speed (km/h) of the strongest wind gust in the 24 hours to midnight

field.name: WindDir9am
field.description: Direction of the wind at 9am

field.name: WindDir3pm
field.description: Direction of the wind at 3pm

field.name: WindSpeed9am
field.description: Wind speed (km/hr) averaged over 10 minutes prior to 9am

field.name: WindSpeed3pm
field.description: Wind speed (km/hr) averaged over 10 minutes prior to 3pm

field.name: Humidity9am
field.description: Humidity (percent) at 9am

field.name: Humidity3pm
field.description: Humidity (percent) at 3pm

field.name: Pressure9am
field.description: Atmospheric pressure (hpa) reduced to mean sea level at 9am

field.name: Pressure3pm
field.description: Atmospheric pressure (hpa) reduced to mean sea level at 3pm

field.name: Cloud9am
field.description:
Fraction of sky obscured by cloud at 9am. This is measured in "oktas", which are a unit
of eigths. It records how many eigths of the sky are obscured by cloud. A 0 measure indicates
completely clear sky whilst an 8 indicates that it is completely overcast.

field.name: Cloud3pm
field.description:
Fraction of sky obscured by cloud (in "oktas": eighths) at 3pm. See Cload9am for a
description of the values

field.name: Temp9am
field.description: Temperature (degrees C) at 9am

field.name: Temp3pm
field.description: Temperature (degrees C) at 3pm

field.name: RainToday
field.description: Boolean: 1 if precipitation (mm) in the 24 hours to 9am exceeds 1mm, otherwise 0

field.name: RainTomorrow
field.description: The amount of next day rain in mm. Used to create response variable RainTomorrow. A kind of measure of the "risk".

recordSet.name: weatherAUS.csv
recordSet.description:
This dataset contains about 10 years of daily weather observations from numerous Australian weather stations. 

RainTomorrow is the target variable to predict. It means -- did it rain the next day, Yes or No? 
This column is Yes if the rain for that day was 1mm or more.

keywords: subject > earth and nature > environment > weather and climate
name: Rain in Australia
description:
### Context
Ever wondered if you should carry an umbrella tomorrow? With this dataset, you can predict **next-day rain** by training classification models on the target variable **RainTomorrow**. 

### Content
This dataset comprises about 10 years of daily weather observations from numerous locations across Australia. 

**RainTomorrow is the target variable to predict. It answers the crucial question: will it rain the next day? (Yes or No).**
- This column is marked 'Yes' if the rain for that day was 1mm or more. 

### Source & Acknowledgements
The observations were gathered from a multitude of weather stations. You can access daily observations from http://www.bom.gov.au/climate/data.
For example, you can check the latest weather observations in Canberra here: [Canberra Weather](http://www.bom.gov.au/climate/dwo/IDCJDW2801.latest.shtml).

Definitions have been adapted from the Bureau of Meteorology's [Climate Data Online](http://www.bom.gov.au/climate/dwo/IDCJDW0000.shtml).
Data source: [Climate Data](http://www.bom.gov.au/climate/dwo/) and [Climate Data Online](http://www.bom.gov.au/climate/data).

Copyright Commonwealth of Australia 2010, Bureau of Meteorology.
